title: Taste of the Town Waynesville - Hoppers
text:
Posted : Thursday, 01 October 2015 9:16PM Taste of the Town Waynesville - Hoppers Jonathan Huskey Reporting jhuskey@kspr.com 
WAYNESVILLE, Mo. -- Friday night is homecoming for the Waynesville Tigers, and also a big-time district matchup with Camdenton. 
Few will be more excited than the folks at Hopper’s Pub off Route 66 in downtown Waynesville. 
“We bleed orange, we are one community and we are definitely Tiger Strong,” said Hopper’s owner Ursula Lebioda. 
Hopper’s is a manifestation of a level of community support rarely seen anymore. 
“Anytime you have support from the community, it makes what we do a whole lot more fun,” said Waynesville head coach Brad Drehle. 
Drehle is learning quickly. He’s in his first year on the job, but his welcome to town came at none other than Hopper’s. 
“When I first took the job here, this is where we came every Sunday,” Drehle said. “We were driving back and forth from Jefferson City and this is where we ate every Sunday.” 
The support isn’t something kept just inside the walls, either. Lebioda plans to deck out the storefront for the Homecoming parade later this week. 
“Our Tiger flags are flying high in downtown Waynesville,” she said. “The opposing team coming in, whoever it would be, sees that and just fears us because the spirit is alive.” 
The Tigers can use that backing on Friday. They’re 2-4 on the year, but just a game back of the Lakers in the district standings. A win would help their playoff position immensely. 
“It’s just going to be a confidence booster,” said senior lineman Sam Roberts. “It’s just going to make us better for the weeks to come.” 
Fueling up those Tigers are the famous burgers from Hopper’s. Ursula is in the middle of a “How many ways can Ursula make a burger?” challenge, and on this particular day, was featuring the Polish burger. 
It starts with a giant burger patty, then Ursula—whose parents are Polish, and Polish was her first language—tops it with sautéed Polish sausage, grilled onion, cheddar cheese and spicy mustard. 
Check out the video above to see the finished product. 
Ursula and the rest of the crew at Hopper’s hopes they can fuel up the Tigers to a win Friday, in this week’s Taste of the Town. Filed Under :
